com.blukii.sdk.config

Class SmartBeacon

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.blukii.sdk.config.Blukii
      • com.blukii.sdk.config.SmartBeacon

  • public final class SmartBeacon
extends Blukii

    Controller class for connection based communication with blukii devices of type SmartBeacon.



    This class contains additional requests that are specific for blukii SmartBeacons.

    See also class SmartBeacon.OnConnectionListener that contains SmartBeacon corresponding callbacks.

    Please following the instructions of the quick start documentation of base class Blukii.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  SmartBeacon.OnConnectionListener
      Abstract class for callbacks of SmartBeacon specific requests.

      • SmartBeacon

        public SmartBeacon(android.content.Context context,
                   android.bluetooth.BluetoothDevice bluetoothDevice)
        Constructor
        See base constructor Blukii.Blukii(Context, BluetoothDevice) for more information.
        Parameters:
        context - a valid context that must not be null
        bluetoothDevice - a valid connectable bluetooth device. Can be detected by class BlukiiClient

    • Method Detail

      • readEddystoneLockState

        public void readEddystoneLockState()
        Reads the Eddystone locked state.

        See writeEddystoneLock(UUID) and writeEddystoneUnlock(UUID) for more information.

        The response data is returned on callback SmartBeacon.OnConnectionListener.onReadEddystoneLockState(boolean, byte)

        This request is only supported for SmartBeacon type "Eddystone" (see Blukii.OnConnectionListener.onReadDeviceFirmware(String, byte)

      • readEddystoneTxPowerLevels

        public void readEddystoneTxPowerLevels()
        Reads the measured Eddystone TxPower Levels.

        See writeEddystoneTxPowerLevels(short, short, short, short) for more information.

        The response data is returned on callback onReadEddystoneTxPowerLevels(byte[], byte)

        This request is only supported for SmartBeacon type "Eddystone" (see Blukii.OnConnectionListener.onReadDeviceFirmware(String, byte)

      • readEddystoneTxPowerMode

        public void readEddystoneTxPowerMode()
        Reads the Eddystone TxPower Mode.

        See writeEddystoneTxPowerMode(int) for more information.

        The response data is returned on callback SmartBeacon.OnConnectionListener.onReadEddystoneTxPowerMode(int, byte)

        This request is only supported for SmartBeacon type "Eddystone" (see Blukii.OnConnectionListener.onReadDeviceFirmware(String, byte)

      • readEddystoneUID

        public void readEddystoneUID()
        Reads the Eddystone UID (namespace and instance ID).

        See writeEddystoneUID(String, String) for more information.

        The response data is returned on callback SmartBeacon.OnConnectionListener.onReadEddystoneUID(String, String, byte)

        This request is only supported for SmartBeacon type "Eddystone" (see Blukii.OnConnectionListener.onReadDeviceFirmware(String, byte)

      • readEddystoneUrl

        public void readEddystoneUrl()
        Reads the Eddystone URL.

        See writeEddystoneUrl(String) for more information.

        The response data is returned on callback SmartBeacon.OnConnectionListener.onReadEddystoneUrl(String, byte)

        This request is only supported for SmartBeacon type "Eddystone" (see Blukii.OnConnectionListener.onReadDeviceFirmware(String, byte)

      • readIBeaconAdvertisement

        public void readIBeaconAdvertisement()
        Reads the iBeacon advertising data: UUID, Major, Minor and MeasuredPower.

        See writeIBeaconAdvertisement(UUID, int, int, short) for more information.

        The response data is splitted in two callbacks that are called both: SmartBeacon.OnConnectionListener.onReadIBeaconUuid(UUID, byte) and SmartBeacon.OnConnectionListener.onReadIBeaconMajorMinorMeasuredPower(int, int, short, byte).

      • readSmartBeaconSettings

        public void readSmartBeaconSettings()
        Reads the global SmartBeacon settings.

        See writeSmartBeaconSettings(int, int, int, int, int, int) for more information.

        The response data is returned on callback SmartBeacon.OnConnectionListener.onReadSmartBeaconSettings(int, int, int, int, int, int, byte) artBeaconSettings(byte[], byte)}

      • writeEddystoneLock

        public void writeEddystoneLock(java.util.UUID key)
        Locks the Eddystone settings against unauthorized changes.

        Note: Eddystone will be lock with a secret key. You can unlock (see writeEddystoneUnlock(UUID)) with this key only.

        The request status is returned on callback SmartBeacon.OnConnectionListener.onWriteEddystoneLock(byte).

        This request is only supported for SmartBeacon type "Eddystone" (see Blukii.OnConnectionListener.onReadDeviceFirmware(String, byte)
        Parameters:
        key - secret lock key as UUID
        See Also:
        readEddystoneLockState()

      • writeEddystoneReset

        public void writeEddystoneReset()
        Resets all Eddystone values to factory default settings.

        Note: This action is only valid if Eddystone is not locked (see readEddystoneLockState()).

        The request status is returned on callback SmartBeacon.OnConnectionListener.onWriteEddystoneReset(byte) .

        This request is only supported for SmartBeacon type "Eddystone" (see Blukii.OnConnectionListener.onReadDeviceFirmware(String, byte)

      • writeEddystoneTxPowerLevels

        public void writeEddystoneTxPowerLevels(short lowest,
                                        short low,
                                        short medium,
                                        short high)
        Writes the Eddystone TxPower Levels.

        You can define the measured TxPower strength for each Eddystone TxPower Mode (see writeEddystoneTxPowerMode(int)) that is received at 0 meters from the device.

        See also the Google definition for Tx Power Level.

        The request status is returned on callback SmartBeacon.OnConnectionListener.onWriteEddystoneTxPowerLevels(byte).

        This request is only supported for SmartBeacon type "Eddystone" (see Blukii.OnConnectionListener.onReadDeviceFirmware(String, byte)
        Parameters:
        lowest - value for SETTING_EDDYSTONE_TXPOWER_MODE_LOWEST in dBm
        low - value for SETTING_EDDYSTONE_TXPOWER_MODE_LOW in dBm
        medium - value for SETTING_EDDYSTONE_TXPOWER_MODE_MEDIUM in dBm
        high - value for SETTING_EDDYSTONE_TXPOWER_MODE_HIGH in dBm
        See Also:
        readEddystoneTxPowerLevels()

      • writeEddystoneTxPowerMode

        public void writeEddystoneTxPowerMode(int mode)
        Writes the Eddystone TxPower Mode.

        This action sets the physical TxPower strength. You can choose between 4 modes thats physical power is defined by the blukii device.

        See also the Google definition for Tx Power Mode.

        The request status is returned on callback SmartBeacon.OnConnectionListener.onWriteEddystoneTxPowerMode(byte).

        This request is only supported for SmartBeacon type "Eddystone" (see Blukii.OnConnectionListener.onReadDeviceFirmware(String, byte)
        Parameters:
        mode - TxPower mode, a constant value of SETTING_EDDYSTONE_TXPOWER_MODE_LOWEST, SETTING_EDDYSTONE_TXPOWER_MODE_LOW, SETTING_EDDYSTONE_TXPOWER_MODE_MEDIUM or SETTING_EDDYSTONE_TXPOWER_MODE_HIGH
        See Also:
        readEddystoneTxPowerMode()

      • writeEddystoneUID

        public void writeEddystoneUID(java.lang.String namespace,
                              java.lang.String instance)
        Writes the Eddystone UID (namespace and instance ID).

        The request status is returned on callback SmartBeacon.OnConnectionListener.onWriteEddystoneUID(byte).

        This request is only supported for SmartBeacon type "Eddystone" (see Blukii.OnConnectionListener.onReadDeviceFirmware(String, byte)
        Parameters:
        namespace - namespace ID: 20 digit hex string
        instance - namespace ID: 12 digit hex string
        See Also:
        readEddystoneUID()

      • writeEddystoneUnlock

        public void writeEddystoneUnlock(java.util.UUID key)
        Unlocks the Eddystone settings.

        Note: You only can unlock, if Eddystone is locked and if you know the secret key that is set by writeEddystoneLock(UUID).

        The request status is returned on callback SmartBeacon.OnConnectionListener.onWriteEddystoneUnlock(byte).

        This request is only supported for SmartBeacon type "Eddystone" (see Blukii.OnConnectionListener.onReadDeviceFirmware(String, byte)
        Parameters:
        key - UUID as secret lock key
        See Also:
        readEddystoneLockState()

      • writeEddystoneUrl

        public void writeEddystoneUrl(java.lang.String url)
        Writes the Eddystone URL.

        The request status is returned on callback SmartBeacon.OnConnectionListener.onWriteEddystoneUrl(byte).

        This request is only supported for SmartBeacon type "Eddystone" (see Blukii.OnConnectionListener.onReadDeviceFirmware(String, byte)
        Parameters:
        url - url string
        See Also:
        readEddystoneUrl()

      • writeIBeaconAdvertisement

        public void writeIBeaconAdvertisement(java.util.UUID uuid,
                                      int major,
                                      int minor,
                                      short measuredPower)
        Writes the iBeacon advertising data: UUID, Major, Minor and MeasuredPower.

        The request status is returned on two calls of callback SmartBeacon.OnConnectionListener.onWriteIBeaconAdvertisement(byte):
        first: status of uuid
        second: status of major, minor and measuredPower
        Parameters:
        uuid - a valid UUID.
        major - major value 0 - 65535.
        minor - minor value 0 - 65535.
        measuredPower - measured RSSI value when the distance between the beacon and the mobile device is 1 meter.
        See Also:
        readIBeaconAdvertisement()

      • writeSmartBeaconSettings

        public void writeSmartBeaconSettings(int selectedFrames,
                                     int selectedAdvertisingType,
                                     int dayTimeStartHour,
                                     int dayTimeStartMinute,
                                     int dayTimeStopHour,
                                     int dayTimeStopMinute)
        Writes the global SmartBeacon settings.

        This action combines a set of core SmartBeacon settings:

        selectedFrames: bitwise summary value of frame types that will be advertised
        • type "InfoBeacon": SETTING_BEACON_FRAME_INFOBEACON_ENVIRONMENT, SETTING_BEACON_FRAME_INFOBEACON_ACCELERATION, SETTING_BEACON_FRAME_INFOBEACON_MAGNETOMETER, SETTING_BEACON_FRAME_IBEACON
        • type "Eddystone": SETTING_BEACON_FRAME_EDDYSTONE_UID, SETTING_BEACON_FRAME_EDDYSTONE_URL, SETTING_BEACON_FRAME_EDDYSTONE_TLM, SETTING_BEACON_FRAME_IBEACON


        selectedAdvertisingType: advertising type of the selected frames, can be SETTING_BEACON_SELECTED_ADVERTISING_TYPE_CONNECTABLE_SCANRESPONSE, SETTING_BEACON_SELECTED_ADVERTISING_TYPE_NONCONNECTABLE_SCANRESPONSE or SETTING_BEACON_SELECTED_ADVERTISING_TYPE_NONCONNECTABLE_NOSCANRESPONSE

        DayTime function: define a limited time of day when the blukii is advertising, e.g. for decreasing battery consumption:
        • dayTimeStartHour: hour of start time: 0 - 23
        • dayTimeStartMinute: minute of start time: 0 - 59
        • dayTimeStopHour: hour of stop time: 0 - 23, larger or equal than daytimeStartHour
        • dayTimeStopMinute: minute of stop time: 0 - 59, larger or equal than dayTimeStartMinute
        • set all value=0 for unlimited advertising


        The request status is returned on callback SmartBeacon.OnConnectionListener.onWriteSmartBeaconSettings(byte).
        See Also:
        readSmartBeaconSettings()
